alert.note: Alert for Portage; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with torrential rain will impact portions of northeastern Portage and southwestern Trumbull Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ravenna. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rain may lead to reduced visibilites, ponding on roadways, and localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Warren, Newton Falls, Lordstown, Garrettsville, Leavittsburg, Windham, Wayland, South Canal and Turnpike Interchange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
